title: HCSU type
content:
Anyone know this font?

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20071024162907im_/http:/typophile.com/files/Untitled-1_4726.jpg)

Thanks,  
Jeremy

 [‹ Sans serif ID needed- very envogue right now](http://web.archive.org/web/20071024162907/http:/typophile.com/node/38393 "Go to previous forum topic") ["Bodegas" - script font ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20071024162907/http:/typophile.com/node/38388 "Go to next forum topic")
author: adpressinc

comments.content: The bad curves reveal that someone tried to fatten up [Handel Gothic](http://web.archive.org/web/20071024162907/http:/www.fontshop.com/fonts/singles/bitstream/handel_gothic_regular_ot/?sample_text=HSCU&sample_size=96&acs_p=1&acs_pt=24&acs=1).

If you want something that wide, I recommend the similar, but more refined [Microgramma](http://web.archive.org/web/20071024162907/http:/www.fontshop.com/fonts/singles/urw/microgramma_extended_bold_ot_std/?sample_text=HSCU&sample_size=74&acs_ss=-1&acs_p=1&acs_pt=24&acs=1).
There you go, Nissan- hadn’t seen that one in while. :-)
Stretching [Alphaville](http://web.archive.org/web/20071024162907/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/shinn/alphaville/) horizontally might leads you to the similar results.
which is almost certainly what it is, with just a hint of squish... well done Mr Angel. Now we can start the ’is xscale a legitimate font, or a flagrant rip-off?’ debate :-)
But why DaFont accepts these kind of entries\_?
